title: Is it wrong that Big Hit lowered the 'Dynamite' sale price to help BTS reach #1 on Billboard Hot 100? - Quora

response.answer_text: first of all, BTS released Dynamite to give armys positive vibes during this pandemic *NOT TO* chart no. 1 on Hot100 It was armys, who made the goal of giving bts a no. 1 Hot100 and 100m views in 24hrs *NOT BTS OR BIGHIT* So please don't assume things or spread false information And now about “Bighit lowering the price and having different versions” Are you a new army or a non-army ? Because you don't know that Bighit does that almost every BTS comeback SINCE 2013 so it's nothing new and they didn' lowered the price or released different versions to chart on Hot100 They have different versions for Make It Right, Mic Drop, Spring Day, I Need U and A LOT of other songs Same goes to the other western artists, which is FINE unlike ticket and merchandise bundling BTS DON’T DO BUNDLING LOWERING THE PRICE OR HAVING DIFFERENT VERSIONS IS NOTHING TO BE ASHAMED OF CUZ THEY'RE STILL SELLING MUSIC AND NOT SELLING T-SHIRTS OR BLANKETS LIKE OTHER WESTERN OR KPOP ARTISTS Here's some examples of having different versions (which is fine) and having merch bundling (which I don't support)  )

It’s a good strategy, but I honestly think whether it was $0.69 or $1.29, the song, timing, and BTS/Army power was going to sell it out the way they did. Fans were thirsty. I was shocked when I saw the price because I was going to buy it no matter what. So no it’s not wrong. It is smart business. This is why I’ve admired BH more than for their different approach to managing their talents. It’s their business acumen and Marketing/PR team.
